svcproc.title: ROTOR MOUNTING
svcproc.para: There are three basic systems for mounting rotors on wheel hubs.

step1.para: Mounting Studs installed into the wheel hub. The rotor is fastened to the wheel hub studs with washers and locknuts. When a rotor mounting stud is replaced, use Loctite Heavy Duty Lock N' Seal No. 277 (red), Loctite Dri-Loc adhesive No. 201 or Loctite 600 on the threads that screw into the wheel hub.
A bolt which passes through a hole in the rotor and the wheel hub. A locknut and flat washer complete the assembly.

A wheel mounting stud that passes through a clearance hole in the rotor and then the serrated portion of the stud is pressed into the hub flange. When installing a new stud use one or more washers as required and a lock nut so that the serrated stud is drawn completely into the wheel hub and the head is firmly seated against the rotor.
